criteria: Knowledge of Risks Leading to Fire-Related Injuries
Application of Knowledge to Reduce Fire Risks
descriptions: Student demonstrates no understanding of fire prevention methods.
Student identifies one basic fire prevention method with limited accuracy.
Student identifies a few fire prevention methods with some inaccuracies or omissions.
Student accurately describes several fire prevention methods.
Student comprehensively explains various fire prevention methods and their application in different scenarios.
Student demonstrates in-depth understanding of fire prevention, including advanced methods and the rationale behind them.
Student shows no awareness of risks associated with fire-related injuries.
Student mentions one or two risks vaguely.
Student identifies a few common risks, but lacks detail or clarity.
Student describes several key risks that can lead to fire-related injuries.
Student thoroughly explains numerous risks and their potential consequences.
Student exhibits comprehensive knowledge of risks, including specific details and advanced concepts, and can relate them to potential injuries.
Student cannot apply knowledge to suggest ways to reduce fire risks.
Student suggests one basic way to reduce fire risks.
Student suggests a few ways to reduce fire risks, but they may be simplistic or not fully effective.
Student proposes effective strategies to reduce fire risks in various situations.
Student details comprehensive and practical strategies to minimize fire risks and prevent injuries.
Student provides innovative and highly effective strategies to reduce fire risks, demonstrating a deep understanding of risk mitigation.
